channel.title: Comments on: This Week in Genesis (15 May 2015)
channel.description: The best new WordPress Genesis things

item.title: By: Carlo
item.dc:creator: Carlo
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://genesiswp.guide/2015-05-15/#comment-51">Nick Davis</a>.
Actually it's best to get the plugin from wordpress.org because the github version is incompatible with Genesis versions less than 2.2
https://wordpress.org/plugins/genesis-advanced-edits/
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Nick Davis.

Actually it’s best to get the plugin from wordpress.org because the github version is incompatible with Genesis versions less than 2.2

https://wordpress.org/plugins/genesis-advanced-edits/

item.title: By: Nick Davis
item.dc:creator: Nick Davis
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://genesiswp.guide/2015-05-15/#comment-50">Carlo</a>.
Hey Carlo, yeah I've seen some of the changes (I follow the GH discussions when I can) I guess I was giving him the benefit of the doubt that he will update but you make a fair point :)
For those following the discussion, you can download Carlo's plugin at the following link, bear in mind that it is built with Genesis 2.2 in mind which is yet to be released at the time of writing (Carlo - if this is not the correct link or you'd prefer a different one, just let me know!).
https://github.com/carlomanf/genesis-advanced-edits
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Carlo.

Hey Carlo, yeah I’ve seen some of the changes (I follow the GH discussions when I can) I guess I was giving him the benefit of the doubt that he will update but you make a fair point ðŸ™‚

For those following the discussion, you can download Carlo’s plugin at the following link, bear in mind that it is built with Genesis 2.2 in mind which is yet to be released at the time of writing (Carlo – if this is not the correct link or you’d prefer a different one, just let me know!).

https://github.com/carlomanf/genesis-advanced-edits

item.title: By: Carlo
item.dc:creator: Carlo
item.description:
I'm not sure how useful that Genesis Post Info & Meta plugin will be, because there are going to be some <em>major</em> changes to the way post info and post meta are handled in Genesis 2.2. (I'm not sure when it will be released)
I have a plugin that does the same thing but I'm a contributor to Genesis so I've made sure my plugin will be compatible with the changes.
item.content:encoded:
I’m not sure how useful that Genesis Post Info & Meta plugin will be, because there are going to be some major changes to the way post info and post meta are handled in Genesis 2.2. (I’m not sure when it will be released)

I have a plugin that does the same thing but I’m a contributor to Genesis so I’ve made sure my plugin will be compatible with the changes.
